result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Michael Lynch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Unpaid Court Obligations

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CM276 and 15CF8

miscConds.notes: Follow any conditions set forth by Agent.

supervisions.notes:
Def is allowed Electronic Home Monitoring. Def must prove to the Sheriff he is employed. ***Defendant is to be furloughed for 3 days starting on February 18, 2019 at 8am to find a job. Defendant is to report back to PCJ on February 21, 2019 at 10am to be hooked up for EHM if he has employment. If Defendant does not have a job he will serve the remaining days in custody. Release date: April 29, 2019.
Pierce County cases 14CM276 and 15CF8

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: 10:40 AM Defendant Nicholas Michael Lynch in court, in custody.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas Michael Lynch appeared by video means. Court: hearing is to deal with letter Def wrote about employement and EHM. Atty Sticht: objects to Def being released, serve out the remainder of his sentence. Defendant is requesting the portion of "prove of employment" be removed from his JOC.  Court orders Def to be furloughed for 3 days -February 18-20 to find a job, released at 8am and report back to PCJ on February 21 at 10am to hooked up for EHM if he has arranged employment.  If Def does not have a job he will serve the remaining of the time in custody. Release date: April 29, 2019 10:47
Hearing on January 29, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Revoked Sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC
from Defendant re: asking the employment aspect of release  Electronic home monitoring off JOC so he can get out and work again.

11:23 AM Defendant Nicholas Michael Lynch in court, in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CM276 and 15CF8 heard at this time. Def wishes to proceed without counsel. Court goes over Waiver of Right to Attorney form with Defendant;  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Atty Sticht agrees to the DOC's recommendation of 1 year on each case; concurrent to each other. Civil Judgment for each case. 164 days credit. Defendant requests 8 months jail with electronic home monitoring. Court orders: 12 months jail in 14CF114, 8 months jail on 14CM276 and 15CF8; concurrent to each other. 164 days credit. Def is granted Electronic Home Monitoring. Def must prove to the Sheriff he has employment. Court enters $268, $243, and $511 as civil judgment. Release date with good time: April 26, 2019.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 11:39
from Nicholas Lynch asking to have his sentencing hearing set as soon as possible.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 10, 2019 at 10:45 am.

10:53 AM  This also includes 14CM276, 15CF8    Defendant Nicholas Michael Lynch in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Judge reviews the defendant's right to an attorney with him. The defendant states he does want an attorney to represent him. Case continued for attorney to be appointed.  10:58
from Probation/Parole Agent Allison Knutson re: asking 12 months on 14CF114, 8 months on 14CM276, and 12 months on 15CF8; all concurrent

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:53 Defendant Nicholas Michael Lynch in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CM276, 14CF114 and 15CF8 heard at this time. OSullivan: 3 years probation. Atty Nelson addresses sentencing; agrees to probation. Defendant address the court.  Court: S/W 3 years probation on 14CF114 and 15CF8 2 years probation on 14CM276; concurrent. Conditions: court costs. any terms set forth by your agent.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Sentencing hearing at 03-15-2016 10:00 am.

9:09 Defendant Nicholas Michael Lynch in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CM276, 15CF8,15CF28, 15CF29, 15CT13 and 15CT14. OSullivan: guilty to Ct#1 in 14CF114, Ct#1 in 14CM276 and Ct#1, Ct#3 in 15CF8. Dismiss remaining counts and cases. Probation and argue jail. Nelson and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. OSullivan will file an amended information on 14CF114 to contain just Ct#1. OSullivan will file an amended information on 15CF8 to contain just the 2 counts the defendant will plea guilty to. Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def was in armed services. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 14CF114, Ct#1 in 14CM276 and Ct#1, Ct#2 in 15CF8; Nelson stipulates to factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#1 in 14CF114, Ct#1 in 14CM276 and Ct#1, Ct#2 in 15CF8, which will be amended in the amended information. Court dismisses 15CF28, 15CF29, 15CT13 and 15CT14. OSullivan requests sentencing on different day. Court: get a sentencing date. Def to remain until he is handed a notice of hearing.
